items.text: I prefer to make my own decisions without relying on others.
items.rationale: Making independent decisions is a core aspect of autonomy.

items.text: I feel restricted when I have to follow strict rules.
items.rationale: Feeling restricted by rules indicates a desire for autonomy.

items.text: I enjoy exploring new ways to solve problems on my own.
items.rationale: Exploring solutions independently reflects autonomy.

items.text: I often question authority and prefer to think for myself.
items.rationale: Questioning authority is a sign of valuing autonomy.

items.text: I like to set my own goals and work towards them.
items.rationale: Setting personal goals is indicative of autonomy.

items.text: I feel most satisfied when I can choose how to spend my time.
items.rationale: Choosing how to spend time is a key aspect of autonomy.

items.text: I resist when others try to control my actions.
items.rationale: Resisting control from others is a sign of autonomy.

items.text: I prefer jobs that allow me to work independently.
items.rationale: Preference for independent work reflects autonomy.

items.text: I feel uncomfortable when I have to conform to others' expectations.
items.rationale: Discomfort with conformity indicates a desire for autonomy.

items.text: I value having the freedom to make my own choices.
items.rationale: Valuing freedom of choice is central to autonomy.

items.text: I often seek out opportunities to express my individuality.
items.rationale: Expressing individuality is a component of autonomy.

items.text: I dislike being micromanaged.
items.rationale: Disliking micromanagement is indicative of autonomy.

items.text: I sometimes enjoy working in teams, but I prefer to have my own responsibilities.
items.rationale: Preference for individual responsibility suggests autonomy, but enjoyment of teams adds ambiguity.

items.text: I like to have a say in the decisions that affect me.
items.rationale: Wanting input in decisions suggests autonomy, but could also relate to relatedness.

items.text: I enjoy learning new skills and applying them effectively.
items.rationale: Could map to Competence due to the focus on skill acquisition and application.

items.text: I feel capable of achieving my goals.
items.rationale: Feeling capable is a direct reflection of competence.

items.text: I enjoy mastering new skills.
items.rationale: Mastering skills is a core aspect of competence.

items.text: I take pride in doing my work well.
items.rationale: Pride in work quality is indicative of competence.

items.text: I often seek feedback to improve my performance.
items.rationale: Seeking feedback for improvement reflects competence.

items.text: I feel confident in my ability to handle challenges.
items.rationale: Confidence in handling challenges is a sign of competence.

items.text: I enjoy setting and achieving challenging goals.
items.rationale: Setting and achieving goals is central to competence.

items.text: I am often recognized for my skills and abilities.
items.rationale: Recognition for skills indicates competence.

items.text: I feel a sense of accomplishment when I complete tasks successfully.
items.rationale: Accomplishment from task completion reflects competence.

items.text: I am motivated to improve my skills continuously.
items.rationale: Continuous skill improvement is a key aspect of competence.

items.text: I often take initiative to learn more about my field.
items.rationale: Taking initiative to learn indicates competence.

items.text: I feel satisfied when I solve difficult problems.
items.rationale: Satisfaction from problem-solving is indicative of competence.

items.text: I sometimes doubt my abilities, but I push through to succeed.
items.rationale: Doubting abilities adds ambiguity, but pushing through suggests competence.

items.text: I like to be challenged, but I also enjoy working with others.
items.rationale: Enjoying challenges suggests competence, but working with others adds ambiguity.

items.text: I feel connected to others when we work towards a common goal.
items.rationale: Could map to Relatedness due to the focus on connection with others.

items.text: I feel a strong sense of belonging with my friends and family.
items.rationale: A sense of belonging is a core aspect of relatedness.

items.text: I enjoy spending time with people I care about.
items.rationale: Enjoying time with loved ones reflects relatedness.

items.text: I feel supported by my social network.
items.rationale: Feeling supported by others is indicative of relatedness.

items.text: I often seek to understand others' perspectives.
items.rationale: Understanding others' perspectives is a component of relatedness.

items.text: I value close and intimate relationships.
items.rationale: Valuing intimacy is central to relatedness.

items.text: I feel happy when I help others.
items.rationale: Helping others and feeling happy about it reflects relatedness.

items.text: I often find myself empathizing with others.
items.rationale: Empathy is a key aspect of relatedness.

items.text: I enjoy being part of a community.
items.rationale: Enjoying community involvement is indicative of relatedness.

items.text: I feel fulfilled when I connect with others on a deep level.
items.rationale: Deep connections with others reflect relatedness.

items.text: I often prioritize my relationships over other commitments.
items.rationale: Prioritizing relationships is a sign of relatedness.

items.text: I feel a strong bond with my colleagues.
items.rationale: Feeling a bond with colleagues indicates relatedness.

items.text: I sometimes feel lonely, but I value my friendships deeply.
items.rationale: Feeling lonely adds ambiguity, but valuing friendships suggests relatedness.

items.text: I like to work in teams, but I also enjoy working independently.
items.rationale: Enjoying teamwork suggests relatedness, but independence adds ambiguity.

items.text: I feel accomplished when I achieve something on my own.
items.rationale: Could map to Autonomy due to the focus on individual achievement.
